meanings.definition: A small amount or nothing at all.
meanings.sent1: I don't have diddley left in my piggy bank.
meanings.sent2: She didn't bring diddley to the potluck.
meanings.sent3: The ant carried diddley on its back.
meanings.sent4: His promises were worth diddley in the end.
meanings.sent5: The old well was dry, not a drop of diddley left.

meanings.definition: A guitar riff or musical sound.
meanings.sent1: The guitarist played a catchy diddley on his guitar.
meanings.sent2: The song started with a classic diddley that got everyone dancing.
meanings.sent3: The birds outside sang a cheerful diddley.
meanings.sent4: The wind carried the sweet diddley of the distant music festival.
meanings.sent5: His fingers danced on the strings, creating a magical diddley.

meanings.definition: A person or thing of little importance or value.
meanings.sent1: He was just a diddley in the big city.
meanings.sent2: The broken toy was now considered diddley by the children.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the mouse was a tiny diddley to play with.
meanings.sent4: In the grand scheme of things, his opinion was diddley.
meanings.sent5: The old coin was rusty and worn, worth diddley to collectors.
